meaningMnemonic: You <radical>say</radical> something about the <radical>circumference</radical> of this area. You've looked around this whole area, making a big circle around it, because you are trying to <kanji>investigate</kanji> something that happened here. You also say this thing in a really quiet <kanji>tone</kanji> of voice, because you don't want the person or thing you're investigating to know you're on to them.
readingMnemonic: "I came here to <kanji>investigate</kanji> this place, and I did indeed find out who the criminal is... it's none other than Mrs. <reading>Chou</reading> (ちょう)!"
